title: Get rich as a car park guard

data.title: Get rich as a car park guard
data.solution:
import sys
import math

s = int(input())
n = int(input())
money = {}
salary = 0
for i in range(n):
    car_id, tip = [int(j) for j in input().split()]
    money[car_id]=tip
car_ids = input().split()
inside = 0
for ID in car_ids:
    ID = int(ID)
    if ID > 0:
        if inside < s:
            salary += money[ID]
            inside += 1
            print(str(ID) + " in | money +" + str(money[ID]) + " | in common: " + str(salary) + " | " + str(inside) + " of " + str(s) + " inside",file=sys.stderr)
        else:
            print(str(ID)+" in | but lot full",file=sys.stderr)
    else:
        inside -= 1
        print(str(ID*-1) + " out | " + str(inside) + " of " + str(s) + " inside",file=sys.stderr)
print(salary)
data.statement:
Peter has finally found a job as a guard in a big car park. He doesn't get any salary, but normally the drivers give him some tip. You have to calculate how many he earned on one day of work.

A driver with a specific [[car ID]] gives Peter [[tip]] when he is able to drive into the car park. If there is no slot available, he won't wait until somebody comes out.

A car will only drive out of the car park (negative [[car ID]]) when it drove in earlier.

It is possible that a car comes multiple times to the car park on one day. In this case, the driver will tip the same every time.

testCases.title: Some like to do it more than once a day
Who said that the car IDs look like so far

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Peter has finally found a job as a guard in a big car park. He doesn't get any salary, but normally the drivers give him some tip. You have to calculate how many he earned on one day of work.

A driver with a specific car ID gives Peter tip when he is able to drive into the car park. If there is no slot available, he won't wait until somebody comes out.

A car will only drive out of the car park (negative car ID) when it drove in earlier.

It is possible that a car comes multiple times to the car park on one day. In this case, the driver will tip the same every time.
Input
number of slots s
number of cars n
for n cars: car ID tip
next line: car IDs or -car IDs separated by a space
Output
earnings of Peter
Constraints
1 <= s <= 50
1 <= n <= 50
0 <= tip
Example
Input
2
3
1 4
2 5
3 2
1 2 -1 3 -3 -2
Output
11
